pkgmetadata.longdescription:
Jitsi Meet is a WebRTC JavaScript application that uses Jitsi Videobridge to provide high quality, scalable video conferencing.
This package provides a convenient (server-side) control service, for both OpenRC and systemd, to allow all necessary subcomponent services to be started, stopped and restarted together. Intended for use on 'single box' installs only; more complex applications should configure the various subcomponents severally.
Automated TLS (HTTPS) certificate management via Let's Encrypt is supported as an option, including automated initial issuance and renewal.
Both OpenRC and systemd are supported, as are both the nginx (preferred) and apache webservers.
_This is the package to emerge_ if you want to install a Jitsi Meet server instance on a Gentoo node, as it will pull in all other necessary components as dependencies.
Once built, issue: emerge --config jitsi-meet-master-config to configure all subcomponents together, after which jitsi-meet-server may be started.

use.flag: Use authbind to access privileged ports without root
Install certbot client and webserver plugin.
